events.1555: Humayun crossed the Indus and captured Lahore and ousted Sikandar Suri of Delhi throne.
events.1880: Nilmoni Phukan, greatest social reformer, prolific writer of Assam, poet, editor, journalist and lawyer, was born at Dibrugarh, Assam.
events.1897: The Chafekar brothers, Damodar and Balkrishna, shot British Officer Rand in Pune. This event played a very important role in the revolutionary freedom fighter.
events.1898: The last total Solar Eclipse of 19th century was seen in India.
events.1910: Mohommed Hussain `Azad', great Urdu poet, eassy writer and critic, died.
events.1917: Mohy-id-Din Hajini, famous Hindi writer and professor, was born at Kashmir (Hajin).
events.1920: Chandrasekhar Trimbak Sarwate, cricketer (batted in 9 Tests for India 1946-52), was born in Sangor, Vidarbha.
events.1935: Vaman Viswanath Kumar, cricketer (useful Madras leggie who only played 2 Tests), was born in Madras.
events.1940: Netaji Subhashchandra Bose established the 'Forward Block' after differences with Congress leaders.
events.1948: Emperor of India title was deleted from His Majesty the King of United Kingdom's titles.
events.1955: Sadashiv Garpatrao Shinde, cricketer (12 wkts in 7 Tests for India), died at the age of 31.
events.1959: Iyengar Kasturi Srinivas, great politician and journalist, passed away.
events.1975: National Emergency was declared and censorship introduced.
events.1982: 19 persons were killed and 25 injured when an Air India Boeing 707 from Singapore via Madras crashed at Bombay.
events.1991: M. Karunanidhi, DMK President, resigned from the Assembly.
events.1993: The centre bans the use of 12 pesticides.
events.1994: L. V. Prasad, father of South Indian film industry, died.
events.1995: India and International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) sign MOU enabling them to visit suspected militants and persons in detention centres only under humanitarian consideration.
events.1996: Saurav Ganguly scores 131 at Lord's on Test debut.
